Great value for money, but regardless of that, there was so much to see, in these immaculately well kept gardens, which were easy to wander around, and a total joy to absorb oneself in. There was a vast array of plants and trees, ferns and spices, and a suspension bridge well worth walking over!. The gardens are set alongside the river, which made for a stunning setting. We travelled by tuk tuk each way which made the entire experience superb and unforgettable.

We went to the Botanical Gardens as part of a two day trip organised by Sam Sampath, Big Brother Tours. Sam had organised a cart and a guide to take us round and I was glad that he did. There is so much to see and a huge area to cover, we learned so much from our guide that we would otherwise never know. The flora is beautiful and the gardens very well maintained. Thoroughly enjoyed our visit and would recommend.

A very good place to visit as part of the visit to Kandy. We used the electric cart for  Lkr 2000 which was worthwhile as the driver was very knowledgeable about the flora and the history. Downside is the poor toilet facilities ( donot even go near them) lack of proper parking facilities.

We thoroughly enjoyed our day walking around these stunning gardens which are beautifully kept. Allow a good 3-4 hours to see everything. There are plenty of seating areas dotted around if you need a rest as well as some picnic areas and a restaurant.  We got caught in a tropical storm and used the time to have a lovely buffet lunch in the restaurant for a reasonable 950 rupees per person.  It was a very enjoyable day out.

An old British era botanical garden- huge and well maintained.  You will beautiful well manicured lawns and some exclusive orchid varieties. Some very exotic and rare trees are found here. Ticket is LKR 1000 for adults and 500 for children. Be prepared for some walking.  There are electric buggies but not sufficient for the crowd.

large , well designed garden with beautiful collection trees and flowers. Especially the tree collection is impressing.I  couldn’t see everything as my driver was waiting. Most of all it is very very well kept. next best to me with the « jardins de pamplemousse » on Mauritius. tip : go urly in  the morning as it  gets stickier around noon

We had such a perfect day exploring the gardens, I’d recommend it to anyone who has some spare time when visiting Kandy, so many interesting things to see, including this strange Irish man pretending to be a tree.

Could have spent a whole day in the Garden as it is just gorgeous. The Garden takes up 147 acres with over 4,000 species. Lots of walking around but I did see a trolley bus. The garden has different areas including the Orchid House, Great Lawn, Lake, Spice Garden (reached via a suspension bridge), Flower Garden and Palm Avenue to name a few all with magnificent plant specimens. It will take a few hours but when you're tired you can sit down on beautiful manicured lawn and rest a while. There's a busy cafe near the Great Lawn but toilets are few and far between.

The botanical gardens are the largest in Sri Lanka, with huge areas of green well kept lawns. There are many different aspects to the gardens which contain specific sections such as orchids, rubber trees, the palm avenue to name a few. Giant fruit bats hang in the trees and fly screeching overhead. There's more than enough to keep you here for a few hours.

We spent a very pleasant 3 hours here and covered most of the gardens. The highlight was the fruit bats which were amazing, spread over the left side of the park and in their thousands. The orchids were beautiful and the trees in the arboretum spectacular, huge buttress roots lianas.  We had cold drinks at a kiosk  and coffee in the cafe, buffet lunch was available. All was good with the exception of 2 gardeners who begged for money. We went on to the 3 temples loop, a nice change to go to sites with only a few other tourists and worth the time.

There are plenty of nature’s delights here. Firstly, the trees are magnificent and there are so many different species, many are endemic. Secondly, you can see a number of colourful birds here. Thirdly, how about the huge red fruit bats that fill the trees in their hundreds! Not to mention the macaques which roam the gardens looking for scraps. There is also a very good cafe which has good value buffet food. If you need to get back to Kandy when your visit is over, and you are fed up haggling with tuktuk drivers, just jump on the bus and pay a few rupees (around 9 pence). Brilliant place.
There are so many varieties of beautiful plants, flowers and spices. Having the monkeys around makes the experience even better. Highly Recommended.

a garden with a huge variety of plants, some not even available in other parts of the world.  a very enjoyable walk and the gardens even had an orchid flower house with different varieties of orchids.

We were taken to the gardens by our guide ‘Obama’. It was a beautiful and relaxing place to visit, except the bangers being set of to scare the fruit bats off! We really enjoyed our time there. The orchid house, the avenue of palms and all the different examples of plants and trees were well worth the visit. We both would definitely like to visit the gardens again.
A spacious and picturesque escape from the hustle and bustle of Kandy. Take the time out for a pleasant stroll (45-60 mins) around the perimeter, or just sit and enjoy refreshments at the restaurant.

It was our first attraction visited in Sri Lanka and one that we found with the best value. Great and majestic with a high diversity of exotic trees and plants. Truly worth the visit. I would recommend going in the morning when it's not too hot.

These gardens are well laid out, with various sections including orchid houses, perennials, and avenues of various trees.  They are clearly labelled so if you like collecting information it is easy to take photos of the notices. A one end of the garden the fruit bats keep up a continuous shrieking. It is quite awesome to see so many of these creatures hanging from the trees. Some of the trees are quite old and have fantastic root structures.  This is a lovely way to spend a couple of hours.
Huge grounds with the most amazing gardebs to easily walk around and enjoy. Lovely orchid house. Watch out for the trees full of bat's at one end. Everyone will enjoy this

It is almost larger than you can take in in one day. I'm glad we went. It was cool to see nutmeg trees for the first time. It was really interesting to stroll under hundreds of roosting bats at the far end of the park. There special environment houses for cacti and orchids. There are many open park areas in which to simply relax and enjoy the surroundings.There are a few pleasant views of the river - and then there is that rickety suspension bridge people stand in line to walk on! But there are few concessions inside the gates and when it got hot, we decided we had enough.

I could've spent at least a day here.  So much to see and take in.  I would've liked the golf buggies to be free to those who need them - or for people at one far end of the garden, trying to get to the other end in 30 degree heat and high humidity!  Nonetheless one of the highlights of my wanders in a city.

Visited here on Jan 21st,2019. This garden is more floral than the Hakgala botanical gardens. Plenty of couples and white skinned foreign tourists here. You can also pay extra to sit in a buggy and see the place with live commentary and photo stops by the driver - which we did here. Since it is quite large if you plan on covering it by foot/walk then plan to easily spend at least 4 hours here.
Had a great few hours here enjoying the green spaces and variety of trees and plants, could have spent a great deal more time exploring. well worth the visit

Botanical garden is located approx. 5.5 km before the Kandy city center bordering Mahaweli river. A historical park dated back to 1371 has over 4000 species of plants including some endemic ones to Sri Lanka. Loved exploring rose and orchid gardens but, felt orchid varieties were not enough. But whatever available wad not disappointing. Enjoyed Walking along the two palm avenues and cabbage avenue. There are more avenues, but couldn't try them all. Entire park is approx. 147 acre which may take 1/2 day to cover.
Great place to escape the madness of the temple of the tooth. Good place for people watch and the café is a nice location if a bit pricey. Would love to spend more time here

Its a beautiful and well-organised garden, with some impressive trees. We were there around 2pm and walked for 2.5 hrs. Alot of shade and a good constant breeze kept us cool. We saw lots of squirrels, monkeys, lizards and a few interesting birds. The kids were pretty excited about spotting these. We also took lots of photos and making silly poses. All the trees and shrubs were impressive, and very interesting. The gardens were well kept and quite beautiful, looking like a scene from an European garden. Great walk after lunch and great family bonding too!

One of the nicest green spaces i've ever experienced Just a quick glance at all the trip advisor reviews on here and its obvious the botanical gardens are popular and highly rated. I can only add weight to that and say that we thoroughly enjoyed spending an afternoon here, though you could spend a full day if you had the time. We were contemplating just having a rest day round the pool at the hotel but decided to make the journey here and we were SO glad we did. Other places should look to this place as an example of a well thought out, maintained and looked after urban green space. It contains a bewildering variety of plants and trees, giant fruit bats hanging from and flying between the trees, monkeys you can get right up close to, lakes, and an orchid house with some of the most amazing flowers. There is a cafe / buffet restaurant in the park, but this would make a lovely place to bring a picnic. If you appreciate and enjoy nature and green spaces then this is a must visit if staying in or near Kandy. It is approx. 15 mins from Kandy city to here by tuk tuk and the fare should cost about 5 GBP. If you have already been on a tuk tuk with a mad driver then you will understand what an 'experience' this is, and if you haven't then do try to experience this at least once in your travels !

A great place to visit just outside Kandy.  15000 rp entrance but beautiful grounds, incredible trees and plants. Good bird life and flying foxes galore.  And the cafe just outside the entrance is cheap and good.

A great place to visit, interesting trees, flying foxes, according to the guide 24,000 of them, a lake, an orchid house and just a really peaceful place to stroll. We could have spent longer here but really enjoyed the visit. If you in Kandy it is a must. Entrance is 1500 rupees.

This place is amazing! I love plants and animals and visiting the beautiful gardens was perfect for me and my husband! You can see a lot of flowers, many types of trees from different parts of the world, friendly monkeys, big bats in the trees and many more. We also loved the orchid house. At the end of our visit, we stopped to the souvenir shop and bought incense sticks and some other local goods for our family and friends.

Very large garden located about 6km away from the city centre (~6 km; 20 mins by tuk tuk). Ticket prices: 1,500 Rs (adult), 1,000 Rs (student. They accept international student IDs). Takes about 2 hrs to go through the garden. Clean, beautiful and great variety of different gardens and plant species. Would highly recommend for those seeking some serenity away from the hustle and bustle of the city.

Enjoyed a full day in these splendid gardens and still didn’t see everything.   Highlights included the incredible mahoganies with their extraordinary roots, the cannonball trees whose flowers are so delicate, the talipot palm with an unusual life cycle and the gracious avenue of palms.   Good buffet lunch at the canteen and a kiosk for later refreshments.

These gardens are offering countless species of local exotic flora. My favorite was royal palms, memorial trees and house of orchids but that is just a tiny part of what you can run into there. Reserve few hours and about about 1500lkr for this large area that is an ideal place for walks and relax.

This is a lovely tranquil place in a very busy Kandy. The gardens are really well maintained. There is an area with fruit bats in loads of trees, an orchid house and a very scary looking suspension bridge. The gardens are really worth a visit.
A beautiful place to spend a couple of hours away from the hustle and bustle of Kandy... giant bamboo... lakes..monkeys and bats. So big it can’t really be crowded... calm and tranquil

This is a very nice botanical garden, with many beautiful flowers in the garden, and a great collection of orchids. There is a pleasant relaxed atmosphere, and we could easily have spent more time there.

This park is gorgeous! It's one of my favourite places in the world because it's extremely beautiful and very well-kept. Plus, if you enjoy being in contact with nature, I'm sure you will love spending some time here!
Visited here while on a tour of Sri Lanka.  What an oasis of calm and tranquility!  Some very impressive tree lined avenues and many fabulous specimen trees.

We visited on a very hot day and there is not a lot of shade. Allow a couple of hours and go on the suspension bridge for photo. The orchid house is amazing there is such a variety of plants and trees. The fruit bats were interesting to see and we also saw lots of monkeys. Definitely needs to be on your itinerary when visiting Kandy.

Impressive collection of Trees from all over the World. A pleasant afternoons' diversion from the mayhem of downtown Kandy. The tree collection is quite spectacular. The Orchid House the Rose Garden etc were a little disappointing. That said I have never seen such a range of tree specimens. The Palm avenue and the Giant Bamboo trees are awesome. Well worth a visit for a couple of hours. More interesting than Kandy itself

200 year old royal botanic garden with a huge variety of flora and fauna to see.  TIPS: thousands of bats live on the island, so if you are lucky (or loom long enough, you will definitely see and hear them. unique experience. I would suggest to plan 1.5 hrs. Garden tours on electric gold vehicles are also on offer for those who cant walk long

A beautiful  tranquil  oasis  of greenery and colour amidst the noise and traffic of downtown  Kandy. What a calming place to visit after a hectic day sightseeing in the urban area. With exotic species  of all kinds plus butterflies and birds that really is too much to do and see in one visit. Highly recommended.

Not somewhere we would normally go but had a spare afternoon and made a visit. Very glad we did, beautiful and extensive gardens full of extraordinary trees and specimens. Need at least a couple of hours to explore - suspension bridge over the river, fruit bats flying about and hanging down/dripping from the trees for the night, fascinating canon ball tree and many more surprises.

If you are in Kandy you must go to the Royal Garden, it's amazing, you can have a picnic in one of the parks, have a nice walk through the day and enjoy the shade with the breeze. Just one advise, in one of the paths, there are a lot of bats so be careful when you walk through that part or avoid it. They don't do anything but just in case you are afraid.

This is quite a large botanical garden and takes at least 2-3 hours to walk around. It can also be quite hot as there are large sections of lawn that are unshaded. It's a nice place for a wander, and the orchid house, although not overly large, is really, really good. There's a cafe in the middle if you want to stop for a rest and cold drink.

Really beautiful gardens. Plenty of space to walk around and relax.Very green and lots of places to stay and enjoy the silence. We have seen many amazing specimens. We enjoyed very much the Cook's Pine Avenue.

One of the best maintained botanical gardens ever visited. If you are interested in the plant life scientifically , or just want to spend some good time in middle of best possible flora, this is the place to be. It's huge, so keep at least 3 hours to be spent here. Secondly, follow the map strictly, else u can easily lose track of places visited. Involves a lot of walking,  so not recommended for very young kids. They also have an option of hiring golf cart, but not sure about the prices.

Definitely worth a visit if you are staying in Kandy! Although the gardens are slightly outside the centre there are plenty of tuk tuks available to take you there (we paid 500lkr each way). Entrance cost 1500 lkr per person. The gardens are lovely and peaceful which came as a welcome break from Kandy’s hustle and bustle. There are a huge selection of trees and flowers and plenty of wildlife too (large bats and monkeys everywhere!). The cafe provided sandwiches and drinks at a good price. Easily spent a couple of hours wandering the grounds.

Personally I'm not really a person who gets all that excited about visiting Botanical gardens but as we'd heard so many positive things about it we thought we should visit and so glad we did.  Its so vast, peaceful and beautiful - and a welcome break from the hustle and bustle of downtown Kandy.  We spent several hours here and loved it - I'm a convert!  There are also golf buggies available for those less mobile.

Truly impressive gardens, that are a peaceful retreat from the hustle and bustle of Kandy city. The range of international species and the design of the gardens is outstanding. Consider taking a picnic, and take plenty of water. The cafe does not offer much in the way of food choices, and the restaurant is one of those dreadful buffet style affairs. There seemed to be limited seating around the gardens. We went on a Sunday and the few seats were taken by rather sweet couples, enjoying some quiet time together.
We popped in for a walk and chill In the peaceful and beautiful surroundings Could have stayed longer but worth it even for an hour Stunning settings

This place was 120 acres of amazing gardens. Tropical plants and trees. Very well kept place. We walked around then found a quiet spot to read a book and enjoy the Beaty and ambience. Great clean toilets. Probably the best place in Kandy if you ask me!!
The bat colonies here is amazing. Thousands of fruit bats hang from banyan trees. They block out the sky when they fly in herds. It's like inside a batman movie.
Great place to visit for a nature tourist. Including over 4000 plants including medicine, orchids, palm trees Etc
Great things to see around every corner and welcome shade for the hotter parts of the day! The gardens are clean and well maintained. Well worth a visit if you need a quiet couple of hours.

Do not be put off by the word "botanical".  This is a beautiful parkland.  We would recommend hiring a guide and also a buggy which in our case was a necessity but even so our tour lasted over an hour.  The history of british monarchs can be traced here with the planting of trees to mark their visits.  There is so much of interest, trees, flowers, butterflies, birds, insects, amphibians, fish..... and our guide was so informative.  Well worth at least a half day visit. The only downside was being ripped off by the tuc tuc drivers.who wait outside.  We were charged 1500 rupees for a journey that should have been 500.  Walk away from the gates and pick up a driver down the road.  The tourist board could help by printing an approximate fare list. Geraldine and Frank

We were hesitant to visit this garden, as we were disappointed with the botanical garden near Nuwara Eliya. The royal botanical gardens, however, are just incredible. They are so vast that you can easily spend 3 hours there. The 1,500 entry fee for foreigners seems justified as you get to see such a big variety of flowers and tropical trees and on top of it all get to see lots of monkeys, fox bats and water buffalos. There are many, huge green spaces where you can just relax or have a small picnic.

The Royal Botanic Gardens are a Must-See for any nature lovers or To escape the noise and grime of busy Kandy.  Peradeniya is 15-min tuk-tuk Ride from Kandy. The grounds are expansive, there are paths and walkways and special exhibit houses for orchids, Cactus, bamboo gardens and more.  The Orchid House was my favorite.
This is a must visit site when in Kandy. Very relaxing garden with plenty of different types trees, flowers and other interesting plants etc. Good reserve around 2-3 hours for the visit.

I had been there for two times and this is my third visit. Every time when i visit Kandy i never forget to visit this garden to have a nice realxing break. I saw beautiful varities of flora they are truely amaizing. People try their best to keep it clean. I recommend this garden for you to have a visit while travelling to Kandy. Love it!!

Kandy i personally love that place, people are very kind and environmental surroundings Garden look perfect and calm but some couples are ruin that place coz people come to watch flowers and trees and enjoy the garden not to watch couples. Please act like responsible people.other than very nice place for family.
Locals pay 60rp Tourist pays 3000rp ($30) Very pretty inside if you like plants and trees. Lots of people and monkeys. I wouldn't go back. Try it, you might like it!
Definitely worth a visit. I spent a beautiful 2 hours walking around the perimeter of the gardens, so much to see and so beautifully set out.
It is a place where you can spend a beatiful 3 hours and really enjoy in nature. It is meticulousy organized and well mantained. Bring a blanket to lay down on some of big lawns and relax.

I used to ride around these gardens when I was a child in the late-1960s and early-1970s. You can't do that now and it's best to hire an electric cart with a guide who can tell you about the plants. Apparently these gardens were first established by a King of Kandy in late-1300 AD. When the British colonised the country they established the Royal Botanical Gardens in 1843. The gardens occupy about 150 acres and are maintained immaculately and meticulously which is great. I spent about an hour because I didn't have time, but I think you need about 3 hours to explore every part of the gardens.
Pleasant walking through all the massive trees. Map was useful. Even though there was a lot of people there it still felt as if you were on your own at times which was lively

If you go to Kandy, make the time to visit these gardens. We entered via the suspension bridge (rather than the main entrance) which is worth doing as it is a nice walk across the river into the gardens. Visit the orchid house, see the monkeys, see the bats (flying between the trees and hanging from overhead branches), and enjoy the peace of this tranquil place. I reckon you could lose a couple of hours here and it would be a great location for a picnic. The area is very well kept and a pleasure to walk around.

It has something for all year round - they have a beautiful rose garden which we did in Sept., we saw the bulbs in Feb., we saw the rock garden in spring & summer - we bought a 'grandparents' pass so we can bring in kids plus 2 other adults when we go so that this is out go to place for out of town visitors, on baby-sitting days sometimes we take our grandchildren & they like the exhibits as well as the jungle gym playground that tires them more than us but we make it our last stop then home - it is 30 minutes from our home which is perfect for us but well worth a trip on its own from farther afield
It was more than i expected from a botanical garden! Delicate, pretty, well orgnized and definitely worth a visit！
This is an interesting garden with variety of orchids, seasonal flowers & trees . Beautifully kept . Needs lots of walking around. Difficult to move if you have toddlers or children.

It is a big garden but the collection we expected was not there. The orchid section was excellent, rest portion not properly maintained. Entry fee is excessive, for srilankan it 60LKR but for others it 1500LKR which looked high in compare to the  collection of varieties but you can pass few hours there because the area is large. Cactus section is small. I can say just nice.
Even if you are not into gardening, this is an amazing place. It's a huge site with some amazing plants and trees. It really is worth spending an afternoon here. Well worth the money.
An absolutely gorgeous garden. Cafes inside with food and drink. You can rent a golf cart to travel around if you want to avoid walking.

It was a beautiful garden and very well maintained. Although it was very busy when we wen there ( I think it was a Saturday), we still managed to find some quite places to enjoy the wonderful flowers and trees. We only had one and a half hours to visit and unfortunately we did not get to see everything. I think you would need about 3-4 hours in order to see everything and not rush. Also, the main entrance is usually really busy so you can take the second entrance and go past the bridge to enter. That one is not that busy. If you go over the bridge, and are afraid of heights be advised that this might not be a thing for you. The bridge is pretty long and goes over a river. Also, sometimes the guard lets kids go on the bridge til the middle and then come back. Naturally, the kids will jump and swing the bridge and also, block the way. All in all a great experience. Would have loved to have had more time though!

This is a few km out of Kandy but well worth a couple of hours. Its quite large but is beautifully kept, very well laid our and plants well signed. A family of monkeys can be seen near the palm trees beyond the lake; many beautiful birds also. The northern part is an arboretum with many tress planted by heads of state and other famous figures, starting with the Prince of Wales in 1887. The orchid house is absolutely beautiful. Nice cafe overlooking the Great Lawn. One of the highlights of our Sri Lanka tour

Botanists will love this vast garden paradise, as it's filled with a diverse and well organized garden. Most of the locals visiting here come as couples, seeking benches and shade for romance. So if you're a tourist with deep interest in plants, you'll find a wealth of resources. More casual visitors can enjoy the beauty of the flowers and a beautiful and peaceful setting. I highly recommend the orchid house for its exotic beauty.
I love royal botanical garden at peradeniya with very beautiful greenaries around the me.very nice land of the heaven.

A really beautiful, expansive, well laid out garden.  Perfect Eden just out of the main city. Informative reading material and map provided at the ticket office. Pleasant restaurant by the main green for lunch and drinks. We spent a wonderful few hours here strolling along the various avenues of plants and trees. A highlight of our stay in Kandy.

It’s a lovely garden with maintained place, plenty of interesting trees to see and knowledge. The orchid house is wonderful. There is a shop if you want to relax and have a cup of coffee. You can simply spend 2 hours to cover all the places. I would like to recommend this place if you can walk long if not you can hire a small car inside the garden.

The Royal Botanical Garden is an absolutely fascinating place. Be ready to walk, as it takes at least 2 hours to go around and enjoy the scenery. The gardens are very well maintained and an absolute must see!

A very beautifully maintained place, the garden is a very pleasant sight. You can easily spend 2-3 hours just walking around if you want to cover all the spots. The map is very accurate and will help you plan your walk around. If you're looking to go onto the rope bridge, you will have to wait as they do not allow more than 5 people at a time, on the bridge. We were pretty excited about it but gave it a miss after seeing the queue for it. It's a favorite among the locals and you'll see a whole lot of kids, couples, families coming in for picnics, strolls and spending some quiet time. Would absolutely recommend comfortable footwear. The orchids were nothing to die for but decently maintained. Worth a visit

Its a nice garden with lots of interesting trees to see and experience such as, double coconut (never heard of it before), giant bamboo tree, 25 varietes of grass. The orchid house is nice with some very delightful species. However the display is not as tastefully done as one would see in places like Singapore or Netherlands. We had to hire a buggy as I was travelling with my elderly parents who would have found it hard to walk the entire length. With the help of the buggy, we saw the garden in an hour. It was handy to have the buggy (which cost 2000 LKR + 500LKR as tip for the driver) as it had started raining heavily while we were still on the rounds. There is a small gift shop and a barrista coffee place too if needed.

If time is short then I would recommend hiring buggy with driver. Buggy seets 7 and costs LKR2000 plus LKR500 tip for driver who doubles as commentator & photographer.  It takes 1 hour & allows you to see most of the garden. Particularly useful if weather is too humid.
What a find, this is beautifully laid out and takes gardens to a new level, meandering walks, cool breezes, shady oasis and plenty of places to simply stop and smell the air.

Beautifully maintained botanical gardens with various zones for types of plants. We especially enjoyed the orchid house and palm tree avenues. Surrounded by the river on most sides, it was an ideal place for local families as well as tourists and enthusiasts. Highly recommended on a sunny day.
A wonderful and amazing escape to gardens with rich history. Enjoy the surrounds, take a picnic and/or a ball, engage with the locals and enjoy.

Good.......Long walking ... Peacefully life ....Greenery.......Fresh air......Peace of mind......green....... atmosphere....... Heaven.....Like Forest....  Double coconut trees ....... Bamboo trees..... squarels sound.....Monkeys.....
Peaceful park with lots of extremely unusual trees from around the world. Also there are quite a few monkeys about which make good viewing.

Acres and acres of gardens but way better maintained than most botanical gardens in India. The collection is quite diverse and rare as the signboards suggest. The whole area is very peaceful and calm - not much rush of tourists. Must visit for plant lovers but even otherwise a nice spot.
If you are going to kandy than u must visit this beautiful garden. The views were mind blowing and soo many trees to learn about and beautiful nature.

Its big enough that you can feel you are in a hollywood movie where you are sent to a new planet and you have special house for each flowers species. No word and describe the beauty nor pictures can show you how beautiful this planet is.

Wow...what a collection of plants.I've never been to Kews Garden but believe that this botanical gardens is on par.We were very much overwhelmed the collection here.We spent 5 hours but suggest to spend the day here.Long walks to experience the beauty of this place. It was very eye opening.A must visit place for all botanist!
We had a relaxing time at the Botanical Gardens in Kandy. This is a must visit place if you love Orchid flowers.

This lush quiet oasis in the middle of busy Kandy was an eye-opener. It was hot (as is usual in Sri Lanka) but when you got under the shade of the many trees the coolness was amazing. The highlight though is the orchid house. It isn't all that big but the number, variety and colours of the orchids is just simply stunning. We walked around a lot if the garden but didn't see all of it by any stretch of the imagination. The Palm Grove is so regal you can just see the maharajahs in procession on their elephants!! Don't miss this.

Very well maintained and an eco-friendly attraction. Recommend to visit this early morning to avoid the heat. You can also hire a buggy to take your around the garden. Only con is that is expensive for foreigners.
The Royal Botanical Gardens at Peradeniya, near Kandy, is worth a visit if you have the time and fancy an interesting walk. There are some majestic old trees and a good orchid house.
Nice gardens even in the rain. However DO NOT let your guide persuade you to eat at the cafeteria. It’s really bad and the service is worse.

Got to the gardens went in back way over the bridge great fun. The different types of trees  and plant's are just amazing.loads of birds flying round and saw the only snake on the whole trip a rat snake just before the wonderful orchid house.with tortoises in the ponds .a great place to visit
The botanical gardens, just outside Kandy, are spectacular. A mix of colourful tropical flora and quiet strolls. Very reminiscent of wandering around Kew gardens in SW London.
Beautiful location... nice stroll around in this beautiful garden- interesting watching the monkeys interacting.... nice time filler
A lot plant houses (eg cactus) were not open to the public.Toilets in the grounds are primitive although thoss in the cafe were clean and western,

The Gardens are probably 5km from Kandy, a short Tuk tuk ride. We spent around 3 hours walking around the Gardens. They are beautifully kept and the Trees are spectacular. The clumps of bamboos add to beauty of the Park as do the plants and the river. In one corner of the Gardens 20 plus thousand fruit bats roost which is a spectacular sight. There are places to take refreshments. I would highly recommend a visit.

We had a one hour guided tour of the gardens. Our guide was very informative and we loved the beautiful surrounds; magnificent trees and avenues, flowers and lawned areas all beautiful set out. Loved the history and the trees planted by notables such as King George V. Definitely worth a visit.

You all must visit this location to spend your day , it's very peaceful and beautiful location , kids can play with the environment , the garden is big , if you walk all along the way , it will take 4-5 hours, there are lot of places to take beautiful photos. Skip raining days

We spent a couple of hours here en route elsewhere, but we could have spent far longer! Lots to see and many fascinating and unusual plants, all clearly labelled. The orchid house was stunning, so many different colours and shapes. Wonderful palm walk, and a fascinating “cannon ball” tree! Tranquil areas for wandering, but also lots of grassy spaces for family games and local wedding photos - as it was the weeeknd when we visited, there was lots happening which gave a lovely insight to Sri Lankan everyday life! There’s also ponds, lakes and even a rope style suspension bridge, which gives great views over the river. Sadly the fruit bats we’d hoped to see weren’t in evidence, but it was a very enjoyable visit indeed!

Visited here whilst in Kandy for the day and loved the place. We took a leisurely stroll down the main path to the green, down palm avenue to the suspension bridge, taken in the orchid house on route. Suspension bridge was fun to walk across but not quite sure why there is a gate in the middle with a sign that states stop. We saw some people get to the gate and turn round and then some people got to the gate and opened it and walked all the way across! Then walked along the side of the river and back round to the main entrance. At a leisurely pace this took about an hour. Nice little cafe by the entrance where I enjoyed a great milkshake. Great gift shop with some lovely items reasonably priced.

Enter the gardens by the back entrance, if possible, so that you can cross the river by rope bridge which makes the experience all the more memorable. The gardens are beautiful and are a lovely place to spend a few hours. In addition to the multitude of plant species there are hundreds of fruit bats hanging from the trees in certain areas. A really pleasant afternoon.

Spent a couple of hours wandering around the gardens, really quiet even though its in the city, Beautiful flowers and even if you are not a natural gardener it is worth a visit and go for a little walk over the suspension bridge. Also worth watching the monkeys raiding the rubbish bins !

A large botanical gardens given near the centre of Kandy. Would recommend as a way to get some peace in Kandy! It was even possible not to hear the horns when in the middle of the park! There are impressive plants particularly the wild bamboo. Can easily spend a couple of hours.

Simply one of the nicest gardens we have been to. The area is so well covered and the gardens are very big. Lots of wildlife. Take your time just walking around such a great area with fantastic scenery.
Poor map is the only downside. However this doesn't take away from the amazing experience here! Lovely scenery and variety! Easy transport links and good value for money

We were surprised to arrive having to pay an entry fee. Tourist fee is 3000LKR. We enjoyed our walk through the gardens. There are a few paths that are outlined by large palm trees that make for a nice photo. There is also a suspension bridge to go on if you wish which has a nice view of the river. We found that there were minimal benches available to sit on, however this could be due to us visiting on a Sunday where there was a combination of lots of tourist and locals around.

The Royal Botanical Gardens are beautiful and well worth finding time for if you like parks and gardens.  There are monkeys in the park so make sure you have any plastic bags hidden out of view otherwise they will try and take them thinking they contain food.  This happened to us but we kept walking, were followed for a bit and then they left us alone.  We then hid our plastic bag (souvenirs from a spice garden) from view in a fabric bag we had.  It was fine, the monkeys weren’t aggressive so don’t be afraid. We spent two hours there and there was still so much to see. The only disappointing thing about the gardens was the restaurant.  It was mainly a limited range western food and the prices were higher than the city because it is a tourist venue.  You would expect this.  The curry was not available so we ended up having an omelette which came with chips only, and a cheese and ham sandwich which was dry and came with chips and a slightly dry very small salad.  The views over the Great Lawn however were stunning. At 1500Rs it is quite expensive compared to other places but it is worth it. There’s a tuk tuk stand outside if you need it.

We visited on a hot afternoon and wandered the many paths _ there is a map and many signs so it's easy to get around. There are many beautiful old trees some straight out of Lord of the Rings! The sky turned overcast and in the sudden downpour we sheltered in the Orchid House. The suspension bridge barely gets the adrenaline going but is still a laugh.It would be really nice to bring a picnic and sit out in a shady spot.

Great day out. The gardens are beautiful, very well kept and lots of different areas. The orchid house is amazing. There was so many different things to see, it took us about three hours to walk round, facilities good, have a lovely lunch in the pavilion. Also there is a suspension bridge which is worth going over. I would highly recommend a trip here for any nature lovers.
Spend 2 to 3 hours wandering through the gardens. The orchid house, the palm trees and bamboos, lakeside and huge lawns, all in wonderful condition. Clean and well worth a mornings walk.

The Botanical Gardens in Kandy are a must visit. Having seen some in India, like the one at Ooty, it is gigantic by comparison. It is exceptionally well kept and cared for. From the enterence to exit , the area is well marked and has excellent species of plants. Do check for timings from local contacts before going. Evenings or early morning are the best time to go.
